summary: This bill, HR 4262, aims to reauthorize various programs related to health professions education. It amends sections of the Public Health Service Act to allocate specific funding amounts for fiscal years 2026-2030 for programs including centers of excellence, scholarships for disadvantaged students, loan repayments and fellowships for faculty, educational assistance, primary care training, dental training, area health education centers, geriatrics education, the National Center for Health Care Workforce Analysis, public health workforce development, and the pediatric specialty loan repayment program.
